intro: Scleria subrostrata, commonly known as the narrow-beak sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with triangular stems and linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and stream banks. Scleria subrostrata is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils.
